alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 3:29PM MDT until June 08 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL CARBON COUNTY... At 329 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain over Roberts and portions of Rock Creek and Clear Creek. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain fell. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Roberts. While the most intense rainfall has moved out of the area at this time, additional thunderstorm development is possible through the afternoon and evening hours. Any thunderstorm that does develop will have the potential to produce another quick 1 to 2 inches of rainfall. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
